statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -12 \\ -6 \\ 15 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 38 \\ 10 \\ -54 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -12 \\ -6 \\ 15 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 38 \\ 10 \\ -54 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
